title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
brief_explanation: This classic novel follows the experiences of Holden Caulfield, a young man who leaves his prep school in Pennsylvania and goes underground in New York City for three days.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
brief_explanation: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality narrated by the young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
brief_explanation: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
brief_explanation: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
brief_explanation: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties, narrated by Nick Carraway.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
brief_explanation: The story of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the giant white sperm whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
brief_explanation: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
brief_explanation: A fantasy novel and prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
brief_explanation: A psychological drama focusing on the moral dilemmas of a young impoverished ex-student in Saint Petersburg.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
brief_explanation: A philosophical novel that enters deeply into the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality.

title: The Master and Margarita
author: Mikhail Bulgakov
brief_explanation: A novel intertwining the story of the Devil visiting Soviet Russia with a story set in ancient Jerusalem.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
brief_explanation: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State of genetically modified citizens and an intelligence-based social hierarchy.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
brief_explanation: A tragic story of a married aristocrat and her affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
brief_explanation: An epic poem that follows the hero Odysseus on his journey home after the Trojan War.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
brief_explanation: A multi-generational story of the Buend√≠a family and the town of Macondo.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
brief_explanation: A philosophical novel about a young man whose portrait ages instead of him.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
brief_explanation: A story about the Joads, an impoverished family from the Dust Bowl region, traveling to California.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bronte
brief_explanation: A story of love and revenge between the Earnshaws and the Lintons.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
brief_explanation: A novel about the adventures of a man who decides to become a knight-errant.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
brief_explanation: A novel that follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.
